Merge pull request #150 from marumari/master

Add support for Mozilla's likelihood indicator

Merge branch 'gdestuynder-risk'

* gdestuynder-risk:
  Fix a few bugs with @gdestuynder's commit
  Add support for mapping grades to Mozilla risk levels Reuse and rename get_grade_for_score to get_grade_and_likelihood_indicator_for_score which now also returns a likelihood_indictor - this is standardized and used to report risk at Mozilla. This stores the mapped likelihood_indicator from this (http observatory) service in the database and outputs it in the json message when retrieving a scan.

Fix a few bugs with @gdestuynder's commit

- No need to grant UPDATE to likelihood_indicator to the API
- Disable filtering of likelihood_indicator from the API response
- Fix there not being enough parameters in the sql query in
insert_test_results

Merge pull request #149 from jarondl/update-readme

Update readme tool reference

Update readme tool reference

There was a link to the deprecated Python tool, and no link to the website
or the Java library (fixes #120)
STYLE: fix indentation in utils.py

Optionally support running against localhost

This adds the `SCANNER_ALLOW_LOCAL` option (controlled via
`scanner.allow_local` in `httpobs.conf` or `HTTPOBS_ALLOW_LOCAL`
environment variable). Allowing to scan localhost or any domain without
dots. Had to fix an implicit assumption on dots in the `contribute.json`
analyzer.

Fixes #65 and helps with #77

Add support for mapping grades to Mozilla risk levels
Reuse and rename get_grade_for_score to get_grade_and_likelihood_indicator_for_score which now also returns a
likelihood_indictor - this is standardized and used to report risk at Mozilla.
This stores the mapped likelihood_indicator from this (http observatory) service in the database and outputs it in the json message when retrieving a scan.

This means the likelihood indicator is static per scan (new scan required if the mapping OR scores change). This is akin to how
refreshing scores and grades (when the score table change) works.

Merge pull request #18 from marumari/master

Another weeks worth of work

Rewrite redirection and ACAO tests

- ACAO test now parses the XML files to see if they're setting the
domain to '*' or if it's a lot more locked down than that
- crossorigin.xml -> crossdomain.xml
- Rewrite redirection test from scratch to have a lot more clarity
Add spacing

Bunch of updates to header tests

- Pull in Google HSTS preload list on startup
- Add support for HSTS preload list in HSTS test
- Modify CSP test to include data as parsed header, instead of raw
- Rewrite CSP test testing
- Modify XFO test to allow for frame-ancestors in CSP
- Rewrite X-XSS-Protection test
- Allow sites to not set X-XSS-Protection if strong CSP policy exists
Rename test results, change a bunch of scores, add tests

Redo a bunch of the retriever

- Add user agent (some sites behave weird if they think you're not a
user)
- crossorigin.xml -> crossdomain.xml
- Disable TLS check
- Bug fixes for sites that return 404 and text/html for .xml files
- Add CORS preflight check (with Origin)

Flesh out celery stuff

- Add a script for the scan-worker
- Move the celery configuration to a file
- Add support for Soft/Hard time limits
Remove TLD check, allow for www

Allow for positive modifiers

Now you can have positive modifiers, so let's account for that.

Also clean up imports.

Mass scanning script

Let's you scan either an Alexa list, or just a file with a bunch of
domains
Clean up imports

Change from tld to publicsuffixlist

tld seems less supported and fails for some international domains, so
switch to using publicsuffixlist

Database modifications

- Clean up imports
- Add two MATERIALIZED VIEWS for convenience (replacing much slower
VIEWs)
- Make pass/fail mandatory

Also scan 'www.'

Create a couple of useful views
